website_summaries.verdict: A distraction-free e-reader that helps kids focus on reading. Simple controls and Bluetooth connectivity for audiobooks.
pros: This e-ink Kindle has streamlined features — and no video or games
An included 1-year FreeTime Unlimited subscription gives kids access to a range of books at different reading levels
cons: Setting up FreeTime Unlimited subscription can be frustrating

customer_reviews.title: AMAZON, YOU KNOW BETTER
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it for my 9 year old because I wanted her to read without being distracted by the videos and games. Honestly, I am highly disappointed, it is in black and white, children are stimulated by the gaiety of color. The navigation is a joke. Amazon/Kindle, you could have done better than this! The concept of JUST an e-reader is great but you all need to go back to the drawing board on this one. By the way, this is my 4th Kindle so my expectations were very high. Come on, Amazon you know better!
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Trash
customer_reviews.text: Just received this device today and I'm ready to throw it out the window. Navigation is horrible and even customer service admitted that they don't know how to help. It's a nightmare trying to get your free subscription set up as they just keep redirecting you to set up a 30 day trial and be charged after. Every book we click on gives us an error message that the book cannot be borrowed right now and after adding books to my daughter's library from my laptop, I'm now getting the error message that "The book is currently unavailable." I'll be cancelling everything and sending this back ASAP. Not worth the time, money or frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: This is a black and white kindle reader. The pictures showed color book covers. This is just one of many disappointing aspects of this product. The functionality is very glitchy and frustrating. Navigation is horrible. Would not recommend anyone to buy this, not even for $5.
customer_reviews.author: Klyborg

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter, 9, loves it. She keeps track of her reading for school and since we got it 5 days ago she's read over 11 hours which is up from her usual 4 to 5. I hope she keeps it up.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: We want our kids to be readers -- this Kindle is the ticket to reading anytime, anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Love it! This is a reader's kindle. We want our children to read -- not play video games all day. From the moment we received this device as a gift, our kids had immediate access to 55 books that we had purchased through our Amazon account. Now they can carry around a whole library of books. Not to mention all of the free out of copyright material that is available. And on top of that, the Amazon Kindle Unlimited gives them access to all sorts of reading material.
customer_reviews.author: DT Coughlin

customer_reviews.title: Great for an adult too!
customer_reviews.text: Got it for myself rather than a child. It's exactly like the more expensive regular Kindle 10th gen and it has a free case and no special offers. It's perfect for an adult, you can turn off freetime and it works just like a regular Kindle. I've been borrowing books from my library using overdrive and sending them to my Kindle easily. Cheap and solid e-reader. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Candace P.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Too small. It claimed to have access to ‘wimpy kid’ book series, only 1 is included. No babysitter’s club or other popular series with grade school age kids, whom I would assume this is targeted at since it’s black and white for reading only. Would not recommend, the only Positive is No Apps!
customer_reviews.author: P. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Freetime unlimited is a JOKE!
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to setup initially and I'm pretty good with technology, support over the phone wasn't great but got us there in the end. Biggest disappointment was freetime unlimited. It's an absolute joke, I've spoken to a couple of other parents and they all say the same thing, the amount of readable books for my 10yr old are a handful at most. I'm not sure where they get the number 1000 from because there are maybe 10 that are the latest good books. So be prepared to still have to buy the kindle version books because the free ones wont cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: The most infuriating device you'll ever buy!
customer_reviews.text: Set up is fairly simple. Fairly. After that, buckle up, you're gonna go for a ride in frustration. The touchscreen is choppy. The navigation is terrible. Adding books isn't so simple since documentation is non-existent. This was to be a Christmas gift for my 9 year old, avid reader. There's absolutely no way I'd give her this garbage. I'm within my return window and will be sending it back ASAP. The fun part is, I now have only two days to find something else as a gift! I'm more than a little pissed off!
customer_reviews.author: David Burke

customer_reviews.title: Opens Up A New World of Reading
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the Kids Kindle for our granddaughter. She loves to read, and the Kindle allows her access to a whole library of books for kids. She is so happy with her Kindle and she would rather read than sit and watch TV.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Good thing to keep them busy. When things get too long, I just give them these and they get busy reading their books. Both have started Harry Potter. I will recommend for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Great for new readers who want to feel grown-up.
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with the quality of the kids version of the Kindle, and despite it being just a little smaller than the adult version it has everything that we have come to expect from an e-reader. My child absolutely loves it, and has been wanting to read more and more. I really like that I am able to see what books she has been reading, how long, and how many pages as well. You can view the information through the device itself, or the parental interface on your web browser.
customer_reviews.author: _WC_

customer_reviews.title: The missing titles show up if you turn off age restriction.
customer_reviews.text: For everyone saying the book titles weren’t available, you have to go to parent control on the amazon website and remove age restriction. You can’t just slide it over to 13+ either, it has to be turned off otherwise most of the better titles are missing.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: hard to navigate impossible to find books
customer_reviews.text: This kids+ thing is a great idea they talk about all these books you have access too but theres no good interface to actually find books appropriate for my kid to read. why is there no way to filter books by age or any category other than "popular" or "new". You have to know the name of a book or your are out of luck. I should be able to manage the books my kid has on her kindle from my parent portal and also intelligently search for and find new books for her through the portal. I cant do that. It is incredibly frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Great but no library reading
customer_reviews.text: Kids love them - more than I expected. Only downside is that they can't read library e-books unless I exit the "safe"kids Freetime library... I might have considered a regular Kindle if I'd known this but fortunately they have been entertained by the free books available.
customer_reviews.author: Sshokie

customer_reviews.title: Should have read the reviews...safe yourself the unnecessary stress, buy your kid a hardcover
customer_reviews.text: "It's just a kindle" is correct. To be suggesting this is a device for kids is sad. If you look at the Amazon page it shows "With Kindle, kids can access thousands of books including kids’ favorites like Harry Potter, Diary of a Wimpy Kid, ..." Nope, 'Diary of a Wimpy Kid' Isn't supported by the hardware, call support and they'll ask you if you 'troubleshooted the issue', right. You'll spend more time trying to find lacking content and struggling with the lack luster interface, your better off just buying your child the hardcovers.
customer_reviews.author: Deniz

customer_reviews.title: Not just for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is the best kept Kindle secret. It's a current generation Kindle reader, so it has a touchscreen and built-in light, but double the storage, 8gb instead of 4, with magnetic case, no ads, and worry free 2 year warranty. You do also get another year of Freetime Unlimited for the kids. But they're not using it on this device - it's all mine!
customer_reviews.author: Tanaquil18

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE GHOSTING PROBLEM!
customer_reviews.text: What ever you do do NOT buy this device! After a little while terrible ghosting problem where you see the screen before "under" your reading screen making it very difficult to read. Their only response is to send you a refurbished one. Read the reviews and websites. This is a VERY common problem and tech support doesn't care. You will not be happy with this at all. Beware and do NOT buy it. The battery life is great, but who cares when you can't read it. The pictures are the ghosting seen.
customer_reviews.author: Watcher

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, software is horrible
customer_reviews.text: The concept behind this is great. If you only want to allow the child to download books from the Freetime app then it's nice, but if you want to leverage the features to purchase books for them and have them transferred to the device, good luck. 2 hours on help chat to figure it out and the solution was to create another account, after they reset the previous account and lost all the books my child was previously reading. The amazon.com/mycontent view doesn't actually show what is on the device. The books are there on the kindle but the manage content doesn't reflect that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C. Farmer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY KID'S EDITION
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy the kindle edition. They make everything so difficult your child will never use it and you will never buy or try to get new books on it. Kindle unlimited is extremely limited. Just get a normal kindle so you don't have to deal with Amazon's garbage unlimited or garbage child "protections" that are just barriers to your child getting new books or you getting new books for your child. I can't say this enough, you will regret getting freetime unlimited.
customer_reviews.author: Cav Trooper

customer_reviews.title: Terrible screen contrast!
customer_reviews.text: I've had three Kindle e-readers. This is the worst screen I have ever seen. It has almost no contrast at all and the letters are just too gray. If you are already a Kindle user, this will be a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Works with Libby
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my elementary aged kid to do summer reading since our libraries are shut right now. It is able to download books via the library's Libby app (on another device), but I took off a star for the clunkiness of the process. You have to borrow the book in Libby, click "open in Kindle" which lets you choose which kindle to put it on, then you borrow the book via Amazon, then you have to go to manage your devices and add the books one by one to your family library. Phew! He isn't into the books in the Freetime Unlimited subscription, and I think he finds it difficult to navigate to get books of interest.
customer_reviews.author: p

customer_reviews.title: Screen light and NO BEDTIME
customer_reviews.text: This device has been a parental nightmare! It has a built-in light, so my child can read it in the dark, and there is no way to set a bedtime! This means my book-loving son will stay up until 3am reading if he has his Kindle. Then he's a cranky, sleep-deprived terror the next day! Amazon! This is awful! Parents need to be able to set limits on these kinds of devices. Now I have to remember to take his Kindle away from him each evening. With his old Kindle, which did not have a light, it was like a regular book. This is something else entirely. It's no longer just a book. It's a device that needs parental controls.
customer_reviews.author: Practically Normal

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 7-year-old. The Free-time unlimited has a good selection of books, from what I can tell. He's downloaded all the Harry Potter books and a ton of superhero books. It's nice and small, and the controls are pretty intuitive. My son didn't need any help using it after the initial setup. He finds and downloads all his own books and he can adjust the text size and screen brightness to suit his needs.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t have the Text-to-Speech option.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly is not worth buying I was gonna return it but when I was gonna do it it was too late! Kids don’t like black and white books at least not my 7 and 5 year old save your money and just add epic! On tour tablet It honestly has better variety and it’s easier to use I originally bought it because I wanted the device to read to my daughter like other kindles do but this one doesn’t even have that option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: If you are a Kindle user, then don't for one second even consider buying this children's version. The content management interface is next to impossible to use. The elusive "FreeTime" product is documented absolutely nowhere, and most of the content it contains is for entertainment, not education. If the Kindle Paperwhite gets an A, this piece of nonsense gets a Z. If you want to purchase a Kindle for a young reader, you'd be much better off to buy a regular Paperwhite, load up the books you want, and lock down the wifi access.
customer_reviews.author: Porchparty10

customer_reviews.title: Great Reading Device for kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: This a great little reading device. My daughter loves reading on it and I'm happy to see her enjoying reading. The size is perfect for holding with one hand and the cover fits nicely. The screen is very easy on the eyes and works in bright light and dim areas. It's a bit cumbersome to add new books through the Kindle Library but once you get it done it's not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Klink

customer_reviews.title: The whole family loves it
customer_reviews.text: Super simple to use. My 8-yr old loves it. I wish it had the ability to have color, particularly on very young children’s books, but it’s otherwise great. No glare on the screen when reading and on-screen controls are easy enough. We chose the rainbow birds case and it looks so cute! Product was pristinely packaged with not even so much as a scratch on the box. I love that it blocks a child’s ability to go online and get books inappropriate for his age. If you don’t know the parental pass code, you can’t even switch users. It’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: MommyMisa

customer_reviews.title: Confusing to use, poor screen resolution
customer_reviews.text: I've had multiple Kindles since the first first model came out in 2007 but this one I find very confusing to use. There doesn't seem to be any complete list of the available free books-- not on the device and not on the parent dashboard-- although recommended books do pop up, but usually nothing we want. The screen resolution is really lousy so when you try to see which books are there you can't decipher the covers. Most of Amazon's online instructions are for the Fire not for the regular reader.
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: Overall, great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a great product. Not all books are free, but you can buy books on amazon kindle and have it added to your child’s account. It is not a one-step process. The screen compares to a paper white, so the pictures are not in color. My children do love these, but are used to the ease of iPads and such, so it took a bit for them to adjust to the slower process and the delays when they press something, for it to register. I do recommend this product, but probably only suitable for ages 6-8.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Strong

customer_reviews.title: Christmas win
customer_reviews.text: Our 9 and 11 year old received these for Christmas while we were on a trip. We set them up in no time and they had their noses in their "books" for the rest of the trip! What a joy to see them reading all the time instead of playing electronics. We couldn't be more pleased, and the kids loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Allio252

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it! One downside for parents
customer_reviews.text: My son has devoured a library full of books on his Kindle. He enjoys grabbing books he loves whenever he wants. The awards are a wonderful addition. My only complaint or suggestion would be for the ability to locate the device. We're on an hour looking for it now and an app to send a signal would be a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: Brad K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This was my daughter’s “big” gift for Christmas. I love all of the features it has! My favorite is how it can clock how quickly your child is reading and helps place them in a reading level. She loves it as she reads 30 minutes every night. The only thing I would wish is that it was a bit bigger. Otherwise it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Britanni E.

customer_reviews.title: Great Reading Device
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old son was given this as a Christmas present this last year and we love it! I love it so much I use it almost as much as him. I usually read books on my phone but I really enjoy this much better because it looks like a real book, not like I am reading on a device. The only complaint I have is that the touch screen is a little weird when turning pages. Sometimes it will turn to the page before or I have to really try to get it to turn, but this is a minor thing. I would recommend this to anyone 7 and up!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Thousands of books at our granddaughters fingertips!
customer_reviews.text: Our 9-year-old granddaughter is a voracious reader. When she opened her kindle, which was her birthday gift, she was ecstatic. She loves this kindle so much that her parents have to limit her reading time. Imagine that in 2020! This kindle allows parents to set the appropriate age range. Also, parents can buy books on their own Amazon account and make them available to the child. I feel this is a good value, even when the subscription moves to the monthly charge of 2.99.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite gift
customer_reviews.text: This was my 8 yo's favorite birthday gift. She reads constantly so we could get ebooks from there library or Amazon free time (came with a one year free subscription). I love the parental control on free time. I can allow what books she can see on her device, look to see what she is reading and for how long. I do wish there were more titles on free time for her she group as she devours books. She loves earning the reading badges - great motivation.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: terrible
customer_reviews.text: very bad quality device! Unbearably slow, horrid display and garbage book selection with unlimited FreeTime. If the pages has images then this device messes up the display. I have to zoom into the parts that have text. And why is it so slow? In this day and age user experience should be much more responsive. This is 10x worse than the palm pilot from the 90s. Junk quality work from Amazon. Total waste of money. They should not even try making these for kids.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to read. Font size is ok.
customer_reviews.text: I was initially worried about the small screen size of kindle, might not be great for the kid’s eyes. However when I got it, I feel pretty comfortable reading it. The font size is adjustable, and the book did adjust the pages for kindle. Surprisingly good. I think it is even more comfortable than fire HD kids version. Switching between amazon free time and parent control panel is easy. Also my kid is super excited about games, so kindle as just a reading device is really good for her. Successful try!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great book only option for kids!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a book only option for my teen - something that would not tempt him to watch you tube or play video games instead. I love my Paperwhite and wanted something very similar for him. This is a great option! He loves that it came with a cover, and I've shared tons of books to his device from our family library. He rarely read books, and yet in the month that he has had this device he has read almost a dozen books! I think the screen is great on your eyes (exactly like my Paperwhite). I have no complaints - and neither does my teen!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Momma

customer_reviews.title: My favorite “book” purchase of the year
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old has been blowing through book after book so having the ability to read books from the local library with her kindle has been amazing. It’s really nice knowing that when she’s on her kindle paper white she’s reading and not playing a game or watching cartoons. I have a paper white of my own and a routine has organically developed each night where we both reach for our kindles and read until bedtime. I’m glad I purchased one for her.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Godoy

customer_reviews.title: Nice kindle for kids. A few tricky things with apps.
customer_reviews.text: My kids are loving it. They know how to use it better than I do. The only thing I don’t like is that to go from the free library to your library requires us to put in the password. I wish it only requires that for any non reading activity. I also wish the free time reading app included more. It often has just the first or first and second of a series. Just enough to make you want more- and then more isn’t there.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Alm

customer_reviews.title: The best purchase of the year!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old son loves his kindle. The only thing that parents need to keep in mind is unless you register your child as an adult, he/she won’t be able to purchase books. This means that if they want to buy a book, they will have to go into your account or you can do it yourself from your account. This is really annoying because now i am getting different Minecraft books as ‘recomended for me’.
customer_reviews.author: Kvato

customer_reviews.title: A great little book/reader during these times of Covid
customer_reviews.text: Since our grandson can't go to the Library, we have the Library come to him on his new Kindle. There are dozens of books already loaded, and they offer access to a huge library for downloads. It is small enough that small hands work well with it. The case is very nice too. Battery life isn't all that long, but it certainly last long enough for him to read what he wants, then put it on the charger over night.
customer_reviews.author: PapPappy

customer_reviews.title: Let down
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this for my newly found love of reading 7 year old daughter but upon using it was a huge fail. The cover is adorable but where is the color on this kindle? Not exciting at all for a child to look at illustrations in color. There is a nice selection of books but the touch screen can be erratic at times, a bit hard to read and just overall not impressed at all. Would much rather have my child read actual books
customer_reviews.author: Lee4kids

customer_reviews.title: Recommended! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Best e-reader. This is my third paperwhite purchase, but this one was for my son. I used mine for 4 years before I broke it (not a product fault, completely my fault). The battery is excellent on these things!
customer_reviews.author: T. N.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 11 year old daughter. She loves to read! I love that it comes with so many good books and on a preteen level. I was worried that the books would be mostly for younger kids but it is amazing! This was by far her favorite birthday gift and she uses it every day!
customer_reviews.author: Beastgirl

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a Kindle to replace using my phone's kindle app at night so I don't get distracted. I bought the kids version for myself to get the case and the unlimited subscription. I use that for the kids on an ipad so we can read stories in color. I find the libraries and collections harder to navigate though on this then on my phone app.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi NJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Kindle with a reasonable price tag.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with my new Kindle. I prefer the plastic outer covering, as I drop things fairly often and it is more robust. The battery life is very good, and the built in light is just bright enough to be useful without causing eyestrain. This edition has the capabilities of the higher end "grown up" Kindle, with a better price tag, and a colorful cover which I happen to like a great deal. It protects the screen and makes it easier to find my Kindle in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: My niece was caught talking to strangers in chat rooms this kindle is Great for kids that you can’t trust and that you want to still have some quality things to do without all the worries
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin&Felicia

customer_reviews.title: Why bother selling this in 2019 - 2020?
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Unusable. Error for every "book". This is kid friendly!? What a joke. Total trash. Better devices in 1995. I'm very adept at setting-up and using tablets, phones, computers. This is so bad it seems like an Amazon April Fools Joke. The only problem is this was a gift for my daughter on Christmas. This isn't April and this isn't funny. Just stop with this thing. All a marketing ploy to seem like it fits the kid niche market. It doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Judd

customer_reviews.title: Zoom feature
customer_reviews.text: I got mine on bestbuy since I was gonna come cheaper, I decided to get the children version due the fact that it came with the free 2 years warranty, a cover and the free time 1 year subscription, so far I can tell that the Kindle kids was a great buy but somehow I keep finding my self trap on the zoom option on some books and hear me out, there's a few book like the whimpy kid series that when you zoom it won't addact to the screen, is ain't a dealer breaking but something to look forward to.
customer_reviews.author: Jarlin Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Kids version kindle not so good
customer_reviews.text: Kindle kids version sucks. I exchanged 2 times because it was working fine in the beginning and then just displayed “waking up “ and was not turning at all. The worst part is I paid brand new price and amazon was sending me refurbished ones even though it’s product mistakes and not user mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Parental controls - not user friendly.
customer_reviews.text: The parental controls are not user friendly. I could not find a way to completely separate my library from theirs( if they figure out my password, they have access to my library). I also cannot find a time limitation - turning the device off at 8:00pm so my child is not reading under the covers! I do like the reading incentive option though.
customer_reviews.author: KDB118

customer_reviews.title: Freetime is NOT customizable on the e-reader
customer_reviews.text: Just spent over an hour on customer service chat trying to remove specific content from the books available via the Kindle's home screen. It's not possible. Apparently the ability to get rid of individual selections is limited to the Freetime app on the Fire tablet. It's not accessible either through the e-reader or the Apple/Google apps. The only "customization" is the age-delimited Freetime content as determined by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Elsa J. F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids who love to read
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing for my 11 year old. She loves to read and this allows her to take her books wherever. The screen size is perfect and how thin and lightweight it is. The only downside we’ve seen so far is sometimes after she pulls it off the charger it acts like she has no books and she has to restart the device.
customer_reviews.author: Laura McGinnis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect present
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my son for his 11th birthday and he is loving it. He loves having lots of different books to read (he’s a huge reader) and he’s found some new series he’s enjoying. Everything seems to be working well, he does have to charge it every few days but that’s probably because he uses it more than a normal person would. My 8 year olds both want these for their birthdays too!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly and short lived
customer_reviews.text: This device has a terrible interface. It's difficult to navigate the menus.and cumbersome to toggle between the child and parents. Amazon free time is even harder to navigate and find books that are actually free and readable in the right age bracket. It also seems that when the free time prescription runs out she'll no longer be able to use the reader at all.
customer_reviews.author: sodaberg

customer_reviews.title: Love it - no ads! Just books with e-ink.
customer_reviews.text: Love this for my kids - it’s a great way to keep them reading and use technology without the “computer” screen that they’re looking at too much anyway. The kindle unlimited is great because they can look for books themselves. They also love the way their pages and books are tracked, and it helps them feel a sense of accomplishment looking back at them.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen R.

customer_reviews.title: Freetime not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The Kindle works great, but the Amazon Freetime content is lacking and contains frankly some odd choices. Series often include only the first book, requiring you to then buy the others on amazon, too much branded content (Disney, marvel, star wars) and a lack of quality children's books. The user interface is terrible, frustrating for an adult to use, let alone a child.
customer_reviews.author: James Morgan

customer_reviews.title: No YouTube is a feature
customer_reviews.text: Pro Sturdy. Survived being dropped multiple times Long battery life Decent selections of free books Don't have to worry about viewing inappropriate YouTube videos because it can't play any videos Con Kids used to iPhone are not impressed by the monochrome screen Slow UI
customer_reviews.author: A. Linton

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to read certain book
customer_reviews.text: We homeschool and this was bought to help with that process. The books that are available are difficult to access and some of the books purchased are not readable on this edition of the kindle. This is not as kid friendly as advertised. It has all of the great features of all the past kindles and I have owned them since Gen 1.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Daily time limits don’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Daily time limit doesn’t work for this device. This device is touted as kid friendly. There’s a parental dashboard, which allows you to add content, adjust age filters and set daily time limits. Oh, but did I mention that there’s tiny text telling you that daily time limits don’t work on kids kindle. “ These settings are not yet available on Kindle Kids Edition devices.”. Then why do you have them!! It’s been released for a while. When is that feature coming out?
customer_reviews.author: J. Pinson

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter Loves It
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter likes the Kindle and loves to read. She has just gotten it and we hope it works as well as the ones we have had over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and find for my avid 9 year old reader.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter that reads more than I think I’ve read in my life! She loves this and I do too. Great buy and you get unlimited books for a year.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first e-reader and I am not impressed. The size is great but the screen glitches and you can barely read the book titles when searching through the categories. When I click a book to start reading there are book shapes (rectangles/square boxes) bleeding through while reading the text. Idk if it'll go away over time while reading or if it's like that all the time. The screen reminds me of an "etch a sketch" it's very light gray color, hard to read. The buttons lag a lot longer than I expected and when I try to exit a book it takes forever!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Fits the need
customer_reviews.text: We got this for more reading options for our 6 year old twins during the pandemic. We cannot get to the library as we had done before and now that they can read they can’t get enough of it. There could be more quality options available but it serves the purpose, and there are no games to distract them.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Moller

customer_reviews.title: Not for reading library books in kid mode
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing! After struggling for several hours, finally discovered that there is NO WAY to share a library book into the kids account!! I read many reviews on this particular kindle and didn’t even think to research if this kindle would function with the library kindle ebooks... because they are kindle ebooks! I’ll try to process a return in the morning! :(
customer_reviews.author: Suburban Mom

customer_reviews.title: If they love to read... Get it
customer_reviews.text: My avid reader can't get enough of her Kindle. Thank you Amazon for the great product with the unlimited reading subscription!
customer_reviews.author: T. Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old son received this for Christmas. It’s the perfect size, love the case, & the free time app. He reads graphic novels rather quickly so this is an easy way for him to have tons of books right at his fingertips! Plus, this kindle is only for reading, which I love!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: The kindle is exactly what you would want in an eReader. If you don't like them, then continue buying books. This product gives me the ability to travel with multiples books without the bulk. Interface is kind of ehh but most eReaders are going to be similar.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Layfield

customer_reviews.title: Should have gotten a regular Kindle
customer_reviews.text: For whatever reason we have not been able to figure out how to exit a book without restarting the entire thing. My son finished a book and no matter where we touched the screen, all it did was flip pages. Very frustrating. Also, adjusting the screen so he can read in different levels of light was a frustrating process too
customer_reviews.author: Linda Scott

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: My almost 9 year old son loves his Kindle. This is his 2nd one. He was jealous because mine had a back light. He was given a reading goal and he met it, so when this one was released, we gave it to him for his half-birthday. We got the solid blue cover so that he can personalize it and decorate it with stickers. According to the Freetime App, he has read for over 5000 minutes since January 1. I recommend this to every parent I come across. My only complaint is the battery doesn't last as long as the old one. but that is to be expected since it has a back light now.
customer_reviews.author: Prynsys03

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 11yrs old and lives to read so this is like her best friend.. u can set up age limits for things that they can see and she lives that it's pink... I love that she can't go on any apps because it's only built to be a reader.. I have the ease of mind knowing that she can read as much as she wants and not get any other online influences..
customer_reviews.author: Walter Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not everything in description true :(
customer_reviews.text: I really love this product, my son is excited about it and about reading. Why two stars? The description lied, in reading about this product I was most impressed by the parent dashboard that would tell me what he was reading and how much. I set up the device and let him go wild and got no dashboard updates. I just found that only fire tablets, iOS, and android get the time and title info..what? It started directly in the description that it was available. Huge disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Baum

customer_reviews.title: Is not compatible with kindle e-reader books
customer_reviews.text: The software on the kindle kids edition is not compatible with kindle ebooks typically purchased through amazon. The entire point of purchasing an ereader was for my daughter to be able to read age appropriate books for school. Of course none of these titles are compatible with this device. Returning today. Also, the screen is entirely black and white, no color pictures which was a quick turn off for my seven year old.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9 year old grandson for Christmas, and he was thrilled. Easy to set up, and use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BSG

customer_reviews.title: Best device!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves to read on this device! It was super easy to setup and load books. He loved it so much that my younger son ended up wanting one too! Now, we have two of them on the kindles!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Gift for my 10 Yr old!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 yr old son loves reading and we were tired of buying books and renting from library. We gifted him this on his 10th birthday and he just can’t get enough of it. Wherever he goes, his kindle goes with him. Plus kindle has humongous library of it own. Never a dull moment with kindle fire!!! Loving it!!!
customer_reviews.author: upasna

customer_reviews.title: Kindle kids edition
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly as described. Very durable, have already dropped it several times. Great battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Denise M. Day

customer_reviews.title: My Daughter is Pleased
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is obsessed with her new Kindle, but my only issue is that it seems to crash frequently and needs to be restarted. The battery doesn't seem to last quite as long as my Paperwhite, but it could be due to her frequent opening and closing of the case.
customer_reviews.author: 5171MilesBookBlog (Ashley)

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 for both my kids and the setup was very easy. Battery seems to last for a long time and was able to adjust the brightness quite. My boys seems to like it, now it is just getting them in the habit to use it consistently. The tools that come with it will make it easy.
customer_reviews.author: 3MSL

customer_reviews.title: What is alternatives?
customer_reviews.text: We are so use to iPad so this seems slower on moving pages. But I wanted my son to have exclusivity reading tablets, so he doesn’t get distracted. For that reason price was right and we don’t have to collect so many books in our book shelf!
customer_reviews.author: Mishbat

customer_reviews.title: Great for AR
customer_reviews.text: This is going to help my little girl get to all of then AR parties! She’s already achieved 5 badges in one day!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Pantello

customer_reviews.title: Mostly awesome for my 6 year old book hungry kid
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES her new Kindle. She loves to read and breezes right through any book I buy her. The Freetime library has helped with that. There are a lot if books she is interested in and it has big selection to choose from. That being said....the format of some of the books does NOT work on the tiny screen. For chapter books, its great, but for illustrated books, they display both pages on a small portion of the already tiny screen, and we can't even read the words. It's quite ridiculous. You can't rotate them horizontally either. Other than that, its wonderful. Every kid should have one.
customer_reviews.author: AwSprout

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8 years old grandson at the beginning of the coronavirus lockdowns. He loves to read and it's hard to get him to put it down. It is very compact and has become a favorite travel companion! I purchased the "Free Time Unlimited" for him as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jan D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the kiddos
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these one for my 9 year old and it’s great for her, for her I’ll give it a 5 star. Now for my son who is just starting out reading, this does not have a great selection of simple big letter books, it does not hold picture books that great. When he gets over the pre-school level of reading this will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Partay Saty

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: Available titles for free are mostly junk. Buying books is cheaper than a real book but you'll still go broke. You can get some books on loan via your library and Overdrive, but there's usually a long wait. Small, dim, sluggish, poor resolution, no color - not much to like. The Fire tablet is even worse - full of garbage apps, sluggish and difficult to navigate, poor battery life. Kids need the full color and size of a real book. Nothing like a trip to the library with a helpful librarian!
customer_reviews.author: Weisenheimer

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to set up FreeTime Unlimited
customer_reviews.text: Kindle Kids book is brand new and still cannot figure out how to set up FreeTime Unlimited on this thing. There are no step by step instructions. Customer service is only via chat and it is useless. They just send me links to Amazon pages that are unhelpful and are intended for the Fire tablet version of the Kindle (you cannot download the app on this).
customer_reviews.author: David A. Hurry

customer_reviews.title: He is motivated even more to read.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves his kindle. I showed him how to find home and how to turn the page he was off and running. He chose his first book and downloaded it. It was a book I have been encouraging him to read but, did not succeed. He likes reading it on his kindle. He has happily reading the book. I have to get him to stop. He dos like to read but I have been hoping that he would widen his interest into new books. Mission accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: maude casey

customer_reviews.title: Great for young readers
customer_reviews.text: The size of this kindle and the access to new material at the young reader's finger tips make this a perfect gift for a young, enthusiastic reader. Our 8 year old daughter received this as a Christmas gift and has already read 4 chapter books. She feels like she is getting "screen time" when using the kindle to read rather than reading from a book. This is a great option to add into the mix. It gives her the freedom and independence to explore new books on her own. However, I have noticed that the touch screen to return to the "home" screen is a little difficult sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M. Canberg

customer_reviews.title: Good but not the best
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and good battery life. One too many software bugs. Lot of times the kids library disappeared and said no books. Have to switch back to the parents account and then get back to the kids profile to bring back his library.
customer_reviews.author: Be nice

customer_reviews.title: Freetime Unlimited is broken garbage
customer_reviews.text: Freetime keeps failing. It keeps saying "there are no books in your library" despite having a constant connection to the internet. I have to exit freetime and reenter it for it to refresh. Basically means my kid can't use it on her own.
customer_reviews.author: Jiffy Bock

customer_reviews.title: I had to return the kindle device
customer_reviews.text: I want to configure my child's kindle so that the child is able to see only the books, I want the child to read. I don't want the child to be able see, the sections: "Books your might like" "Top pick" "Popular Books" , etc. So far there is no way to do this. I googled the issue and noticed a number of people have the same concern.
customer_reviews.author: Olu

customer_reviews.title: Good to safe on paper and shelf space
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter to read more. It works to a certain degree, but I miss that in the kids version it doesn’t have a color screen. Also the writing is a little washy (?) like it is a little out of focus, not sharp, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Constanze

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I thought this had sound. What a waste of money. Not to mention it’s black and grey only.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda & Kids

customer_reviews.title: some books not available?!
customer_reviews.text: Henry and Mudge books are not available on this... why??!! It’s available on other kindles! What’s the difference with this one? 1 Star for this! Everything else is great my 6 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.author: L. Sandino

customer_reviews.title: Get your kids to read!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old granddaughter loves to read so this was perfect for her. She was very excited and immediately downloaded books. I like the parental access so that we can keep up with how many books she reads and how much time she spends reading.
customer_reviews.author: grumpysister

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love the device in a while but still discovering Freetime a bit more. There aren’t as many familiar titles as we’d hope but so far a great range of books. Not sure how to connect my kid friendly books from my kindle account to my child’s so still need to play around with that but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Lee

customer_reviews.title: kids kindle
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old has fallen in love with reading using his kindle due to it being so light weight and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: My brother bought this for my kids as a gift but my kids ages (10 & 6) found it too small to read. The free subscription that it says it comes with, never worked for us. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Nishi

product_meta.title: Kindle Kids Edition - Includes cover, 1 year of Freetime Unlimited and 2-Year Worry-Free Guarantee - Blue Cover
feature_bullets: Includes a Kindle (10th generation), 1 year of FreeTime Unlimited, a kid-friendly cover, and 2-year worry-free guarantee - up to a $219 value.

Kindle Kids Edition is purpose-built for reading, with a black & white glare-free display and weeks of battery life. It performs differently than a tablet, because it’s geared for reading books – no games, ads or videos means zero distractions.

With the included year of FreeTime Unlimited, kids can explore popular titles and series. After 1 year, your subscription will automatically renew every month starting at just $2.99/month plus applicable tax. You may cancel at any time by visiting the Amazon Parent Dashboard or contacting Customer Service.
FreeTime Unlimited includes the complete Harry Potter series, and the first book from other popular series such as Artemis Fowl. Parents can purchase additional titles from the Kindle Store.
Take the library with you. Kindle Kids Edition holds over a thousand FreeTime Unlimited titles and provides weeks of battery life.
2-year warranty: If it breaks, return it and we’ll replace it for free.
Now with Audible. Pair with Bluetooth headphones or speakers to listen to your story.
